themes: Need for flexible and rapid-response funding
Transparency and clarity in funding eligibility (underrepresented vs. all artists)
Data-driven grant evaluation (attendee and artist costs)
Simplification and best practices from other cities
key_phrases: Keep a portion of the funding set aside each time for last minute funding
Not every great creative opportunity comes months in advance
the whole funding would probably work better as community recommendation, staff edited, reviewed & approved by arts commission
Include # of attendees in grant application, and cost per attendee, and cost per artist, and portion going to artists/creatives
Have more flexibility in amounts, maybe minimums/maximums, but not everyone needs 5k
The grant cycle should never be down
Decide if this is a fund for historically underrepresented artists or all austin artists
Look at best practices from other cities and keep it simple
barriers_identified: Missed opportunities due to inflexible funding cycles
Lack of clarity about eligibility for underrepresented vs. all artists
Inflexible grant amounts not matching project needs
solutions_proposed: Set aside funding for last minute projects that staff can approve or recommend
Use community recommendation, staff editing, and arts commission approval for funding decisions
Require grant applications to include attendee numbers, cost per attendee, cost per artist, and portion going to artists
Allow more flexibility in grant amounts with possible minimums/maximums
Ensure the grant cycle is always operational during revisions
Clarify whether funding is for all Austin artists or only historically underrepresented artists, and adjust application language or scoring accordingly
Adopt best practices from other cities and simplify the process
